definition:
Let $A$ be a commutative ring. Then $M$ if *faithfully flat* if for any
$A$-modules $P, Q$, and $R$, we have $$\begin{aligned}
0{\rightarrow}P{\rightarrow}Q{\rightarrow}R{\rightarrow}0\end{aligned}$$
is exact if and only if the $M$-tensored sequence $$\begin{aligned}
0{\rightarrow}M\otimes_A P{\rightarrow}M\otimes_A Q{\rightarrow}M\otimes_A R{\rightarrow}0\end{aligned}$$
is exact. (Note that the “if and only if” clause makes this stronger
than the definition of flatness).

Equivalently, an $A$-module $M$ is faithfully flat iff $M$ is flat and
the functor $-\otimes_A M$ is a faithful functor (and hence the name).
